_header: This world foul is and cleanseth lite
Note:
Cf. Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no. 15467.
Bibliographic Ghosts: Spalding, Lincolnshire, Spalding Gentlemen’s Society M.J.B.14 [olim Maurice Johnson No. LIV], f. 83v: not in this MS.
_description: On shunning greed — a tag in the Fasciculus morum, translating a Latin distich

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Þis world vs fuleþ and clansyth lyteOff fulþe þer
                    yn who be quite

Bod187.Transcription:
Thys wordle vs defylþ& clansyth but a lyteOf filþe
                    þat ys þerynneWho can hym best quyte
Bod187.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 180.

Bod410.Transcription:
this world vs foules & clanset lyte of fylth þerinne who be
                    qwyte

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Þis world fyle ys and clansyt lyteOf fylþe þerinne who
                    may be quyte
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 179.

EDU82.Transcription:
The worlde is fule and clensyth lyteOff fylthe ther in whoo may be
                    qwyte

Lincoln44.Transcription:
þis worle ys foul and clanseþ lytOf fulþe þerin
                    ho may be quite

WorcF19.Transcription:
þis worle fyle ous fulet & clanseth lyteof fulth ther inne
                    he may be quite
WorcF19.Attributed Title:
quod ex que deus ipse detestatur & … (f.
                    194va)
